text: Inside the flight deck it's ghostly vacant, rows of empty flight chairs and numerous guidance computers gently blinking. With half filled coffee-cups and jackets hung o the seat backs... it appears the control deck has been suddenly evacuated. Muffled SCREAMS are heard somewhere deeper inside the shi
As the entire world watched in wonder, there were only a few, skeptical of the journey's success.

Only a few... who would be right. The further we move into the ship... signs of violence appear, smears of dark blood sharply standing out on the bright white paneling and several broken computer screens The muffled SCREAMS grow louder and clearer... an argumen between men, panicked rage over-lapping.

CAMERA slowly moves past a corner to see the middle-of a violent confrontation. One OFFICER is locked inside a sle chamber, banging on the glass and pleading with panic. Another OFFICER is on the floor, mortally wounded, his bo still twitching with his head bashed in. The INSANE OFFIC a young corporal is moving from terminal to terminal, typ in commands with a casual and emotionless nature. Blood streams have run down his face from both ears and n as he continues to type commands into the flight computer heightening the trapped OFFICER'S muffled,. screams.
The INSANE OFFICER hits the final command key and warning buzzers ignite with flashing lights. He closes his eyes, taking a breath of relief.
The trapped OFFICER begins pounding on the glass with a crazed panic as the INSANE OFFICER calmly goes to his own sleep-pod and climbs inside, sealing the hatch.

Control panels flash and hydraulics ignite. Like a row of tumbling dominos, each of the sleep-chamber pods shift positions with a SHUSH of hydraulics and then... they are launched with a ROAR of micro-jets.

We're suddenly back into the unsettling silence as... lik bee hive that's exploded, thousands of coffin-sized sleep pods are ejected from the ship in unison. They are sent tumbling into open space in every direction as the ship slowly continues its unaffected course.
The trapped OFFICER is seen SCREAMING in silence inside h own pod.
We slowly float towards an astroid field. As we grow clos it's the sea of sleep pods slowly floating through space.

Where was I... when I heard we'd lost Eden? Just like every other kid on my block... I was dreaming... of being one who would be chosen to follow. As we move closer to the asteroid field of sleep pods, it obvious that time has passed, a single skeleton inside ea of the pods, hands in a clawing position towards the glas We PUSH IN towards one pod, moving towards the SKULL, sti locked in a SCREAMING position, wide mouthed and...

A RUMBLE passes... EYELIDS TWITCH... A GASP. Inside a coffin-size chamber, a dim glow of light seeps through a small glass porthole. A MAN is asleep, a mask attached to his face, tubes of liquid feeding into his ar CORPORAL BOWER, military physique, chiseled features. His chest lightly expanding, blood pulsating through his vein Lights FLICKER PAST and his body comes to life, muscles flinching, breath quickening. He squirms with discomfort, ripping away the mask. He gasps, trying to SCREAM.

His scream is muffled under three inches of glass. The ha door is hit with a THUD and white gases erupt from the ed THUD, THUD... THUD! The door bursts open and BOWER scampe out, struggling to rip away the feeding tubes. He HITS th floor, naked and gasping. His pores ignite, dripping swea He tries to get to his feet, but his legs wobble undernea him, collapsing. He yells at the floor.

Burns are red! Bruises... blue- His voice echoes into the dark, alone in a cavernous room he pauses, struggling for orientation. He gets to his fee muscles twitching. His short-cropped hair is... pure whit

Hey...? HEY!!? Someone? A constant low RUMBLE is present, joined by the occasiona MOAN and CREAK of a large ship. A SHUDDER travels through the room with a random FLICKER of LIGHTS to reveal... A massive steel compartment, tangled with technology. It' cold and institutional. High-tech computer terminals slop out of the floor. The FLICKER passes, taking us into blac We hear him: fumbling through the room, switches are thro with no result and compartments are pulled opened and... SNAP! A glow stick comes to life. He squints at his darkened surroundings with confusion. A drip of liquid catches his eye and he staggers back to hi sleep pod. He grabs the dangling tubes that were ripped f his arm and he sucks on the tube, pulling as much liquid his mouth as possible. After a few heavy gulps, he suddenly heaves towards the floor. He painfully forces himself to drink, gasping. He looks up to notice two sleep chambers next to his own. leans closer with the glow stick to see the first one, th name plate reading; 2nd Lt. Cooper. It's EMPTY. The third pod's name plate reads; LT. PAYTON. Deep inside there is the figure of a man, asleep under a mask.
Payton? Lieutenant... Payton? He turns back to his own pod, seeing the name plate that reads; CORPORAL BOWER. Even this name doesn't seem famili

Bower? Bower...? The loss of memory heightens his fear even more as a shiv travels through his body while he staggers towards a near computer terminal. He taps the keys on a computer termina Nothing. He frowns, leaning closer.

As he taps the keyboard, powder blooms out from under his fingers. He wipes the surface of the panel to see a thick layer of dust. Under the smear is... Elysium - Flight Systems - Operation Terminal #87153-D. He pulls focus to see... his FINGERS are trembling uncontrollably, an odd vibration of nerves. He slowly mak a fist with concern.
BOWER walks along a row of storage lockers reading each n plate. He stops at the locker labelled; Corp. Bower. He pauses, mumbling the name once again with no recognition.

Bower. He opens the locker to see an assortment of personalized belongings, uniform and gear, none of it seeming familiar He uses a towel to wipe off the layer of sweat and oily substance coating his body, pausing to see an identificat tattoo on his forearm that reads: FLT>>005A015. He pulls on a black flight suit, emblems and military markings of rank on the chest. He pulls on shoes and a to belt with a high powered pen-lamp. On the inside of the locker is a emergency manual card wi block figures displaying breathing and stretching exercis labelled; Hyper-Sleep Disorientation Recovery Procedures.

(reading to himself) .in the event of mild memory loss... resulting from extended- He freezes on... A PHOTO tucked inside the door. EVALON, beautiful young woman smiling towards camera. He stares a the-photo, his frown deepening with confusion. He checks back for a name, but nothing. He tucks the photo into a pocket and exits.
BOWER waves his hand over a sensor... no power. He steps front of a heavy set of steel doors, flipping several switches and... nothing.

BOWER breaks open a storage bin, pulling out beverage pac and a cup, taking a seat at the control desk. With Evalon photograph leaned against the console, he becomes lost in gaze as he gulps down nutrient pills and stirs an instant coffee as we...
There is a conflict in his eyes, memories trying to retur
An image FLASHES past, EVALON smiling as BOWER kneels nex her, gripping her hands. BOWER'S gaze remains hollow, frown deepening as he sips t cup and... winces with disgust.

Faa-uck! Distant THUMPS. He pans the pen-lamp across the ceiling a toward the sounds... PAYTON'S sleep chamber. THUMP, THUMP, THUMP: Muffled and desperate. CRACK! Bower jumps back as someone kicks their way out from inside, th hatch bursting open. Out climbs... PAYTON, a man in his forties, but the rugged physique of man half his age, lean and agile. His military-style hair cut is also pure white. Gasping for breath, he hits the floor as BOWER tries to help him. PAYTON jerks with shock
Whoa! Hey... easy! Lt. Payton? You're- Sir... whoa! PAYTON chokes and gasps, then glances up, giving Bower a over with a frown and a sobering tone.
Who are you?
Bower. Corporal... Bower, sir. I'm the-
Bower?
That's right. You're waking from
Corporal?
Yes, sir. This is disorientation from-
corporal... Bower.
Yes. That's right, I'm-
Wanna get that fucking light out of my eyes, pal?
Sorry... sir. PAYTON rubs his face with a frown.
Where... are we?
We're aboard the Elysium. From what I've
Elysium...? Where are we?
I don't... really know. There's no power in the com and I can't even-
Where's the... rest of the crew? It's our shift? Our rotation-
I believe so.
Aren't they suppose to be here... to wake us?
Sir... I don't know where anyone is. PAYTON takes breaths, trying to regain his senses, glanci around at their darkened surroundings.
Hit the lights, will ya?
Ah... we're having some power problems-
Who woke you up?
Umm, not sure. It had to have been the flight computer. There's no one here... (off his look) .except us.
Cold in here. BOWER grabs him a towel and water container, turning back see PAYTON doesn't waste any time, stretching his limbs.
There's no power coming off the main grid. Can't fire any of the... (searching for word) Dynos. Can't even open the doors. PAYTON glances to the other empty sleep-chamber with a fr
(off his look) Our 2nd Lieutenant? I don't know where he is. It was empty when I woke up. None of the systems are on-line. Mainframe is down, so I don't know how or why it engaged independently-
Bower .
Yeah?
Until I have two coffees you're just gonna have to repeat all this shit, so let's just idle here for a bit.
Sorry. I just- Just glad to see you awake. i was... a little concerned. I didn't know what to do if- PAYTON gets to his feet, stumbling. BOWER catches him und the arm as they stagger into the wall.
Easy... Lieutenant. Easy.
Coffee?
I'm on it.
Good man. BOWER helps him to the locker room as LIGHTS FLICKER past

PAYTON staggers along the row of storage lockers as BOWER helps guide him with the flashlight beam. PAYTON pauses w a frown as he glances across the name-plates, none of the seeming familiar. BOWER gestures toward the locker, the n plate reads: LT. PAYTON.
This is you, sir.
How do you know that?

1 It's... the name on your sleep pod, sir. PAYTON opens the door to see his belongings inside, a pho of WIFE (MARIANNE) inside the door. He stares at it with utter confusion. BOWER takes this in, looking to the memo recovery card inside the locker.
it says that the memory loss is only suppose to be a momentary loss that's-

Very reassuring. I guess when you gamma the brain into extended REM, sometimes it can take a while to get it back. PAYTON pulls on his flight uniform and squeezes his feet his shoes. BOWER notices the identification tattoo on his forearm, partially obscured from view; FLT>>00... (obscured by grime, hair and angle). Unlike hi own, PAYTON'S tattoo is faded with age.
I've been awake for at least an hour and I still can't remember my... anything.
Listen, the last time I crawled out of a hyper bunk, it took me... quite a while to get it all back. BOWER holds his frown as PAYTON squeezes his finger into wedding ring.
What was... your last flight, sir?
Don't recall. The Kuiper Belt odyssey? Don't worry, it'll come back, eventually. PAYTON kisses the photo of his wife.
I've gone through this before. I just can't remember why I would agree to do it again. PAYTON goes to close his locker and BOWER motions with a serious tone.
Sir? I know this is going to sound strange, but do you even know where we're going? I can remember the training, but... not the mission. Know the procedures, not the... destination.
I figured you'd tell me.
Didn't even know the ship's name until I saw it-on the console. For all I know this was another damn training exercise-
Trust me, it's not. if this is a simulation... PAYTON notices both of their reflections off the mirrored panel inside the locker... revealing their WHITE HAIR.
Someone is taking the joke a little far. He shuts the locker and they exit, the flashlight's beam panning away, taking us into darkness.
BOWER and PAYTON are standing at the control console, the screens flickering with distortion. BOWER hands him a cof and PAYTON takes a sip... with a wince of disgust.
None of the activators are working.

Figures. We can ride two hundred thousand tons of space freighter across the galaxy without a dent in the hood, but can't get one good cup of coffee. PAYTON flips a few switches with no result of power.

Without the mainframe, we can't connect. I don't know how we'll ever be able to- PAYTON is in his element at the control desk, flipping op an emergency auxiliary-power panel. He snaps open a handl and he forcefully gives it several rotations with a MOAN whirling magnetos. The hand-crank allows a dim glow of electricity to the light panels.
Oh, I- didn't even think of that.
PAYTON gives him a look with a grin and flips a switch.
Payton on the con. Respond? This is Lt. Payton of flight Team...? Shit-
Five.
Five? How do you know that? BOWER pulls up his sleeve, exposing his tattoo ID. PAYTON nods, "good thinking."
Lt. Payton of Flight Team Five. Does anyone copy? Anyone... respond? Anyone awake up there? Dead static.
Team Four suppose to be here for the shift rotation. Where could they be?
Fucking teamsters. Maybe they couldn't get to us. BOWER eyes the third empty sleep-chamber.
Where could he have gone? PAYTON gazes off blankly. A RUMBLE of FLICKERING LIGHTS p and the computer screens slowly fade, going black.
The power systems must be free-floating off blown circuits or something. The over-ride grid won't even lock in.
Whatta ya think?
I think we need to find a deck of cards and call the union. Distant THUMPS are heard overhead and they freeze... watc the ceiling with uncertainty.
Somebody... is up there.
Hmm. Ventilation... maybe. Systems keep re-booting after each surge. That could be anything. THUMPS fade as the ship eerily MOANS and CREAKS.

I say we get out of here. I'd rather be up and out then stuck in the trunk. The room is blocked by the two heavy steel doors on eithe end, security doors ten feet wide. PAYTON leads the way towards one end, gesturing towards the doors.

We're not far from the bridge but without the circuits locked in... I don't know how we could ever get this thing open. As they approach, their flashlight beams pan across the d to see jagged chips and scratches all along the edges. To are scattered on the floor, the control panel ripped open
Jesus. Somebody was trying to get out.
Ironic. I think it was built to protect us.
(gesturing to the third pod) Well, he got out... some how. A RUMBLE approaches... another SHUDDER that FLICKERS the lights. They watch the ceiling as BOWER counts in his hea as it fades.
Cycle is broken.
What?
It's not circuitry. Reactor timing is off-set in the core. Seems sporadic, but it's not. Each revolution decreasing before starting over from the beginning.
It's trying to reconnect, but it won't until it's reset.
How the hell do you know that?
I dunno. I can't remember my own- but I know everything there is to know about that damn reactor.
The training stuck.
And I know that... Another SHUDDER approaches.

That's twelve revolutions, before recycling. And this one will only last- As they watch the ceiling, their flashlight beams stop on small ventilation shaft that's been ripped open. They exchange a look and...
Their lights spill inside an endless steel shaft only a f and a half in diameter, leading into darkness.
Now if we only had a monkey and a rope. PAYTON climbs down as BOWER rotates his jaw with eagernes
Our 2nd Lieutenant must have gone this way. Don't you think?
Must have.
It's the only way out.
I think we're better off... waiting here-
For what? If the mainframe is off-line-
We're not going to be able to get to the bridge or even be able to open that door from the other side-
But we can at least find out what's
Do you remember just how big this ship is, kid? We don't know where that will come out, if at all-
But, we can at least try to-
I can't do that.
Can't do... Sir?
Listen, I have to take a handful of Doxitol just to get in the hyper-bunk.
You're... claustrophobic?
I can take a lot, that's not one of 'em.
I can take it.
Real boy scout, is that it? You get lost in there and you're a footnote in the
You can guide me... over two-way. PAYTON eyes him over with reluctance.
You know there's something wrong. How long can we wait in here before we have to try something?
(gesturing to 2nd Lt pod) How long did he wait? Silent stare as a SHUDDER passes, flickering the lights.
What if no one else is awake and there's no one at the wheel?

They dig through compartments, collecting tools. BOWER pu on a boom-mic, clips the radio on his belt and tests the transmitter. PAYTON goes through a drawer of office supplies, handing him an ENVELOPE OPENER.
Just in case... (off his look) .there's mail you need to open quickly. BOWER tucks it into a zipper pocket and his photograph fa out. PAYTON watches as he tucks it back in and zips up.
Wife...?
Yeah... I think so.
Must be newlyweds. How can you forget something like that?
What do-you remember? Anything yet?
Some pieces.
Still a little fuzzy but you're the cocky little shit who wanted the window seat?
And you're the cranky old bastard who made me take the aisle.
Give it some more time, pal.
